trans-unit.source: Base class for all persistence related commands.
Commands are distinguished by their Name.
Usually commands can also be distinguished by their derived type.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.DurableInstancing.InstancePersistenceCommand"></xref> class.
The XName (the combination of namespace and name) of the command.
Indicates whether the command could attempt to acquire a lock on the instance.
The command classes that derive from this class can override this property to set it to `true`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the command acquires a lock on the instance;, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the persistence provider may choose not to enlist in the ambient transaction (Transaction.Currnet) when executing this command.
The command classes that derive from this class can override this property to set it to `true`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_True" name="True" href=""></xref> if enlisting in the transaction is optional for this command, otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the name of the persistence command.
An XName (the combination of namespace and name).
Commands override Validate to ensure that a command is valid to execute at the current time.
Implementations should throw an InvalidOperationException if the command is not valid to execute against the InstanceView passed as a parameter.
The Validate method is called by InstanceStore before the command is passed to InstanceStore.TryCommand.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.DurableInstancing.InstanceView"></xref> object representing the current state of the instance handle.
